title: Firewall rules
description: Firewall rules allow you to create rules that inspect incoming traffic and take action on specific requests.
cfExtendedDescription: A firewall rule uses a [filter](#filters) to select traffic. For more information, refer to [Manage firewall rules via the APIs](https://developers.cloudflare.com/firewall/api/).

links.title: Get firewall rules
links.description: Fetches firewall rules in a zone. You can filter the results using several optional parameters.

id.description: The unique identifier of the firewall rule.

description.description: A case-insensitive string to find in the description.

action.description: The action to search for. Must be an exact match.

paused.description: When true, indicates that the firewall rule is currently paused.

per_page.description: Number of firewall rules per page.

links.title: Get a firewall rule
links.description: Fetches the details of a firewall rule.

id.description: The unique identifier of the firewall rule.

links.title: Create firewall rules
links.description: Create one or more firewall rules.
links.curl:
curl -X POST "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/firewall/rules" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '[{"id":"372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b60","action":"block","products":["waf"],"priority":50,"paused":false,"description":"Blocks traffic identified during investigation for MIR-31","ref":"MIR-31","filter":{"id":"372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b61","expression":"(http.request.uri.path ~ \".*wp-login.php\" or http.request.uri.path ~ \".*xmlrpc.php\") and ip.addr ne 172.16.22.155","paused":false,"description":"Restrict access from these browsers on this address range.","ref":"FIL-100"}}]'

id.description: The unique identifier of the firewall rule.

action.description: The action to apply to a matched request. The `log` action is only available on an Enterprise plan.

items.description: A list of products to bypass for a request when using the `bypass` action.

priority.description: The priority of the rule. Optional value used to define the processing order. A lower number indicates a higher priority. If not provided, rules with a defined priority will be processed before rules without a priority.

paused.description: When true, indicates that the firewall rule is currently paused.

description.example: "Blocks traffic identified during investigation for MIR-31"
description.description: An informative summary of the firewall rule.

ref.description: A short reference tag. Allows you to select related firewall rules.

filter.example:
{
  "id": "372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b61",
  "expression": "(http.request.uri.path ~ \".*wp-login.php\" or http.request.uri.path ~ \".*xmlrpc.php\") and ip.addr ne 172.16.22.155",
  "paused": false,
  "description": "Restrict access from these browsers on this address range.",
  "ref": "FIL-100"
}

id.description: The unique identifier of the filter.

expression.description: The filter expression. For more information, refer to [Expressions](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ruleset-engine/rules-language/expressions/).

paused.description: When true, indicates that the filter is currently paused.

description.example: "Restrict access from these browsers on this address range."
description.description: An informative summary of the filter.

ref.description: A short reference tag. Allows you to select related filters.

parameters.example:
{
  "id": "372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b60",
  "action": "block",
  "products": [
    "waf"
  ],
  "priority": 50,
  "paused": false,
  "description": "Blocks traffic identified during investigation for MIR-31",
  "ref": "MIR-31",
  "filter": {
    "id": "372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b61",
    "expression": "(http.request.uri.path ~ \".*wp-login.php\" or http.request.uri.path ~ \".*xmlrpc.php\") and ip.addr ne 172.16.22.155",
    "paused": false,
    "description": "Restrict access from these browsers on this address range.",
    "ref": "FIL-100"
  }
}

links.title: Update firewall rules
links.description: Updates one or more existing firewall rules.
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/firewall/rules" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '[{"id":"372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b60","action":"block","products":["waf"],"priority":50,"paused":false,"description":"Blocks traffic identified during investigation for MIR-31","ref":"MIR-31","filter":{"id":"372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b61","expression":"(http.request.uri.path ~ \".*wp-login.php\" or http.request.uri.path ~ \".*xmlrpc.php\") and ip.addr ne 172.16.22.155","paused":false,"description":"Restrict access from these browsers on this address range.","ref":"FIL-100"}}]'

id.description: The unique identifier of the firewall rule.

action.description: The action to apply to a matched request. The `log` action is only available on an Enterprise plan.

items.description: A list of products to bypass for a request when using the `bypass` action.

priority.description: The priority of the rule. Optional value used to define the processing order. A lower number indicates a higher priority. If not provided, rules with a defined priority will be processed before rules without a priority.

paused.description: When true, indicates that the firewall rule is currently paused.

description.example: "Blocks traffic identified during investigation for MIR-31"
description.description: An informative summary of the firewall rule.

ref.description: A short reference tag. Allows you to select related firewall rules.

filter.example:

  "id": "372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b61",
  "expression": "(http.request.uri.path ~ \".*wp-login.php\" or http.request.uri.path ~ \".*xmlrpc.php\") and ip.addr ne 172.16.22.155",
  "paused": false,
  "description": "Restrict access from these browsers on this address range.",
  "ref": "FIL-100"
}

id.description: The unique identifier of the filter.

expression.description: The filter expression. For more information, refer to [Expressions](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ruleset-engine/rules-language/expressions/).

paused.description: When true, indicates that the filter is currently paused.

description.example: "Restrict access from these browsers on this address range."
description.description: An informative summary of the filter.

ref.description: A short reference tag. Allows you to select related filters.

parameters.example:
{
  "id": "372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b60",
  "action": "block",
  "products": [
    "waf"
  ],
  "priority": 50,
  "paused": false,
  "description": "Blocks traffic identified during investigation for MIR-31",
  "ref": "MIR-31",
  "filter": {
    "id": "372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b61",
    "expression": "(http.request.uri.path ~ \".*wp-login.php\" or http.request.uri.path ~ \".*xmlrpc.php\") and ip.addr ne 172.16.22.155",
    "paused": false,
    "description": "Restrict access from these browsers on this address range.",
    "ref": "FIL-100"
  }
}

links.title: Update priority of firewall rules
links.description: Updates the priority of existing firewall rules.

id.description: The unique identifier of the firewall rule.

priority.description: The priority of the rule. Optional value used to define the processing order. A lower number indicates a higher priority. If not provided, rules with a defined priority will be processed before rules without a priority.

links.title: Update priority of a firewall rule
links.description: Updates the priority of an existing firewall rule.

id.description: The unique identifier of the firewall rule.

priority.description: The priority of the rule. Optional value used to define the processing order. A lower number indicates a higher priority. If not provided, rules with a defined priority will be processed before rules without a priority.

links.title: Delete firewall rules

id.description: The unique identifier of the firewall rule.

links.title: Delete a firewall rule

delete_filter_if_unused.description: When true, indicates that Cloudflare should also delete the associated filter if there are no other firewall rules referencing the filter.
